intro: Loeflingia baetica subsp. vaucheri, commonly known as the Baetica vaucheri, is a rare and endemic plant species native to southern Spain. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The species thrives in rocky, arid environments, often found in limestone soils. Its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat degradation, it is considered vulnerable and requires careful protection.
